newsitem.title: JAMAICA: Jamaica to resume hanging convicted murderers.
newsitem.headline: Jamaica to resume hanging convicted murderers.

text.p: The Jamaican government has reinstated the death penalty as part of a plan to crack down on crime.
There have been 730 murders in Jamaica this year, and officials fear the current rate of crime will exceed the record 800 murders during a violent 1980 general election.
National security minister K. D. Knight said in parliament late on Tuesday the Cabinet had approved the resumption of hangings to punish convicted murderers.

The government is also organising intelligence gathering units within the police force, to "target local and multinational organised crime, focus on gang disruption and monitor the financial aspects of the drug trade," he said.
The new anti-crime plan is the third government attempt to deal with the problem in the last three years.
